meanings.definition: The process of erosion or deposition that creates a flat surface.
meanings.sent1: The planation of the land resulted in a smooth, level area.
meanings.sent2: After years of planation, the valley became flat and even.
meanings.sent3: The planation of the beach made it perfect for a game of beach volleyball.
meanings.sent4: The planation of the field was like nature's way of ironing out wrinkles in the earth.
meanings.sent5: The planation of the hillside was so gradual that it seemed like a gentle hand smoothing it down.

meanings.definition: The act of forming a flat surface through erosion or deposition.
meanings.sent1: The planation of the riverbank was evident after the floodwaters receded.
meanings.sent2: The planation of the canyon walls showed the power of water over time.
meanings.sent3: The planation of the garden beds made it easier to plant flowers in neat rows.
meanings.sent4: The planation of the desert floor was like a giant artist's canvas waiting to be painted.
meanings.sent5: The planation of the plateau was so precise, it looked like it was done by a skilled craftsman.
